result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court reminds the defendant to follow the bonds and conditions of bonds as ordered.

3:34 PM Defendant Andrew B Ulrick in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anne Renc in court for Andrew B Ulrick. 
All files heard: 22CF115 (status), 22CF206, 22CF270

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

This was set for a Status Conference.
Initial Appearance had been held on 02/28/22

7/20/2022 : Court orders $1,500 cash bond for all 3 cases: 22CF-206, 22CF-270 and 22CF-115.
Comply with all previous conditions.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
State's Letter to Judge Baker Withdrawing Bond Modification Motion (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 07/20/22 sp)

Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew B Ulrick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Andrew B Ulrick. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-206 and 22CF-270.

1:14 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

These matters are on for warrant appearances.

BY THE COURT:
Warrants are quashed. 

Atty Soule has no comment as to Defendant's non appearance previously.

Court addresses the parties regarding 757.19(2c).
Court will recuse itself but under subdivision 3, it may be waived if all parties agree.

1:17 PM Court leaves the bench.
Atty Soule addresses Defendant regarding to today's hearing.
Defendant is okay with proceeding with this Court for today's hearing and is okay to having this Court set bond.

1:18 PM Court returns to the bench.
Court addresses the parties.
Parties wish to go forward today.
State does not object.
Defendant concurs.

BY THE COURT:
Court feels parties made determination to continue with today's hearing and waiving conflict.

State addresses bond.
22CF-206 has a signature bond set.
State requests the signature bond be converted to a cash bond.
In 22CF-270, State requests $2,000 cash bond for reasons stated. 
State would withdraw motion to amend bond in 22CF-115.
Atty Soule requests signature bonds.

Address of Defendant is verified.
Person is waving in the courtroom. Grandmother.

Court states facts, for the record.
Court questions Atty Cassidy for clarifications.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $1,500 cash bond for all 3 cases: 22CF-206, 22CF-270 and 22CF-115.
Comply with all previous conditions.Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 


22CF-270: Atty Soule has not been appointed to this case today, and has not had a chance to talk to her client, requests matter rescheduled.
Initial Appearance - August 1st at 1:15 PM.

22CF-206:Initial Appearance - August 1st at 1:15 PM.
22CF-115: Will be set for status to track with other two cases.

Court orders State to file motion to withdraw the modification of bond hearing.
Status conference for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

DA Molepske informs the Court that the defendant has missed numerous Pre-Trial Supervision Appointments and
makes additional statements on the record.
Atty Soule informs the Court that her client did not have a vehicle so that is the reason for the missed appointments and 
he should now be able to make the required appointments.

3:44 PM Defendant Andrew B Ulrick in court.  District Attorney (DA) Louis John Molepske Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Andrew B Ulrick. 

3:45 p.m.  Plover Police Officer J Anderson is sworn in.
Direct examination by DA Molepske.
3:46 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
3:48 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Soule.
DA Molepske has no redirect.
3:49 p.m.  Witness is excused.
DA Molepske has no further witnesses.
Atty Soule has no witnesses.
DA Molepske has no final argument.
Atty Soule has no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:40 PM Defendant Andrew B Ulrick in court.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Andrew B Ulrick. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Time limits are not waived.
Court informs the defendant that he has not been reporting to JusticePoint and makes additional statements on the record.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Same conditions as previously ordered: 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew B Ulrick appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail. Attorney Taylor O Soule for Andrew B Ulrick appeared in court. 

Court questions Atty Soule regarding the reason for non-appearance. 
Atty Soule responds. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed. 

Atty Soule indicates a public defender will be appointed for this defendant. 

State recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule makes bond arguments to the court and requests a signature bond. 
Court questions Atty Soule further with regards to non attendance at day report. 
Defendant makes statements.  Will go to day report and will appear at court appearances. 
Court questions the defendant further. 
Defendant responds and makes statements regarding a job at Pixel.  His grandma will give him a ride to day report.  

BY THE COURT:  
Court will give the defendant one last chance and reinstate the bond and conditions. 
He is to keep in touch with the public defender and his attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:16 PM Defendant Andrew B Ulrick not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cassidy requests a warrant with a $500 cash alternative.  
Court reviews the file. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant with a $500 cash alternative.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1

BOND RE-INSTATED ON 3/16/2022, WITH CONDITIONS AS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED:

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

1:08 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of possession of meth and drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant is not eligible for public defender eligibility.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a  signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: February 28, 2022  @  2 p.m.  in Branch 1
